thread.title: UEFA conducts eight-team draw in Nyon
thread.title_full: UEFA conducts eight-team draw in Nyon

title: UEFA conducts eight-team draw in Nyon
text:
UEFA conducts eight-team draw in Nyon 
  
With the 54-nation Group Stage of the Euro 2016 Qualifiers coming to an end last week, officials from UEFA gathered in the Swiss city of Nyon to conduct a draw for the tournament's Playoff Round. 
UEFA General Secretary Gianni Infantino on the left is joined by former French striker Dominique Rocheteau for the draw... with Ukraine and Slovenia the first two names out. Eight of the nine teams that finished third in Qualifying are in the Playoffs. The top-ranked third-place side, Turkey, advance straight to the Round of 24, leaving the other eight to learn their fates. Those sides square off next month, to fill the final four spots next year in France. 
The two-legged showdowns are set for November 12th to 14th, with reverse fixtures a few days later. The match-ups are Ukraine versus Slovenia, Sweden clashing with Denmark, 2014 World Cup qualifiers Bosnia-Herzegovina taking on Ireland, and Norway facing Hungary. Related Videos
